intro: Souroubea loczyi, commonly known as the African souroubea, is a small, deciduous shrub native to parts of Africa. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae, which includes many species with milky sap. The plant is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and small, yellowish-green flowers. It typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to arid conditions. Souroubea loczyi is often used in traditional medicine for its potential health benefits.
